results.title: Tommy Tricker and the Stamp Traveller
results.creator_credit: Les Productions La Fete, Rock Demers and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: In this rollicking tale two members of a school stamp club, the artful scammer and a timid Ralph James compete to find an album of precious stamp treasures hidden on the other side of the world. In trying to track down the hidden stamps, Ralph and his sister, Nancy, uncover a secret magical formula that allows anyone who believes in magic to become so tiny they can ride in the picture on a postage stamp. But Ralph and Nancy are not the only ones with the secret. Tommy Tricker has also discovered the secret. Tommy Tricker has also discovered this method of travel and arrives in Australia before Ralph… but who will find the stamps?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Productions La Fete, Rock Demers and Michael Rubbo

results.title: Tommy by The Who
results.creator_credit: Robert Stigwood Organisation, Robert Stigwood and Ken Russell
results.brief_description: Tommy by The Who is based upon the Rock Opera by Pete Townshend with additional material by John Entwistle and Keith Moon. It is the story of a deaf, dumb and blind boy who is eventually cured and becomes a rock celebrity. Features Oliver Reed, Ann-Margret, Roger Daltrey and Elton John with guest appearances by Eric Clapton, John Entwistle, Keith Moon, Paul Nicholas, Jack Nicholson, Robert Powell, Pete Townshend and Tina Turner.

results.title: Tommy's world
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and Margot Lethlean
results.brief_description: Made with the help of Myra Hilsendorf and Victoria’s Art Project, this film utilizes the art of mentally retarded people to provide an indication of their potential capabilities. Introduces the view to Tommy’s world through his drawings and also shows the paintings of other handicapped people. The vitality, immediacy and emotional impact of their work challenges the viewer to examine conventional attitudes towards handicapped people. No dialogue, musical background only.

results.title: Tommy
results.brief_description: Using interviews with and about Tommy Woodcock, this program tells the story of one of Australia’s most renowned racehorse trainers. In particular it concentrates on his work with Phar Lap and Reckless.

results.title: Tomi Ungerer: storyteller
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: An interview with Tomi Ungerer, a delightful man and gifted visual storyteller. Includes animated sequences based on three of his published illustrated books: “Moon man”, “The Three robbers” and “The Beast of M. Racine”.

results.title: Tombstone
results.creator_credit: Buena Vista, Sean Daniel, et al and George Pan Cosmatos
results.brief_description: A high-energy action adventure based on legend rather than historical finds facts Wyatt Earp (Kurt Russell) desiring to retire from law enforcement. With brothers Virgil (Sam Elliot) and Morgan (Bill Paxton), he arrives in Tombstone, Arizona intending to build his fortune. He discovers long-time friend Doc Holliday (Val Kilmer) is there and that the town is run by a group of brutal outlaws called the Cowboys. Earp, frustrated with his laudanum-addicted wife, begins a romance with the travelling stage actress Josephine Marcus (Dana Delaney). Meanwhile, the Cowboys terrorise the citizens of Tombstone unchecked. The stage is set for the ultimate Wild West showdown - a gunfight at the OK Corral.

results.title: Tomb of the lost king
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Roy Davies
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chronicle”.
With the discovery in 1977 of Royal Tombs in the Greek village of Vergina, Greek archaeologist Manolis Andronikos uncovered the greatest prize left in Greek archaeology - the tomb of Philip II of Macedon. Shows the magnificent objects found inside the tomb including a mural believed to be the work of the ancient artist Nico Marco and examines the work and theories of the archaeologist. Narrated by Andrew Faulds.

results.title: Tom Thumb
results.brief_description: Based on the Grimm Brothers’ fairy tale, this is a wonderfully fanciful motion picture filled with a host of stunning special effects. Soar away on the wings of your imagination to a world of forest spirits, where puppets come alive, where starcrossed lovers have their fondest dreams come true - where Tom Thumb will dance his way right into your heart.

results.title: Tom Phillips
results.creator_credit: Arbor Films, Arts Council of Great Britain, Margaret Williams and David Rowan
results.brief_description: Covers many aspects of Tom Phillips’ work which includes painting, drawing, graphics and music. Features commentary by Phillips about his two collage works “Humument” and “Benches” providing a fascinating insight into the mind of this original and creative artist.
